page.title: 13West Newton Village
page.content:
This small village stands on the southern edge of Sandringham Park. It has grown steadily since the acquisition of the Sandringham Estate by The Royal Family. Some 150 people live in cottages, bungalows and a few houses made from local carstone ( a ginger-coloured sandstone) dressed with red brick.
Most of those who live here either work on or have worked on the estate, but there are a number of retired people who have come from other Royal Houses.
It is a friendly place, with a church, (St. Peter's) a school, a Post Office/ General stores and a club with its own bar.
